Events.RelatedBody:
First, Excuse for my poor english. It'ts my first post here.
Because I need a new date for my file DocumentFormat.OpenXml.dll (instead of the initial 01/06/2018),
I tried to compile the project to get a new dll. But I get Compiler Error CS0107 (More than one protection modifier..).
Thanks for your help.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19156977/36789697-baf06b32-1c92-11e8-938e-eabe06fc28f1.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Version 2.8.1 with .NET 4.7.1 creates dozens of unneeded library references" (#401) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

If you add version 2.8.1 (via NuGet) to a project that targets .NET 4.7.1, then it will pull down dozens of System.X libraries, some of which will causes reference issues with larger projects. 

**Information**

- .NET Target: 4.7.1
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.8.1

**Repro**
Create a new solution with a console app project targeting 4.7.1. Add version 2.8.1 via NuGet. 

**Observed**

Dozens of extra unneeded libraries are added. 

**Expected**

It should only add 3 additional libraries: 
* Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms
* NETStandard.Library
* System.IO.Packaging

**Workaround**
If you install NETStandard.Library before DocumentFormat.OpenXml, and upgrade Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms, then only additional library installed is System.IO.Packaging.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Get images recursively from AlternateContents" (#211) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
If an image is inside a TextBox for example, it is not included in the HTML.
This modification allows to get all the images of any AlternateContents, ignoring the Fallbacks

Opened pull request "Fix xunit warnings" (#209) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody: In a previous commit, xunit was updated. Xunit now comes with a number of analyzers that check for best practices, which left a number of warnings in the project. This fixes that.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update projects to use NuGet and new csproj format" (#148) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
As part of being able to support .NET Core, this change does the following:

- Update to the latest NuGet of DocumentFormat.OpenXml
- Convert projects to use the new csproj format (will allow .NET Standard targeting at a later point)
- Consolidates solution files into one file that has the tool, tests, and examples
- Removes the cmdlets (as suggested by @EricWhiteDev)

Initial support for #116
